summary: Magnesium sulfate (MgSO4) is a white, crystalline chemical compound made up of magnesium and sulfate ions. It's soluble in water and often found as a hydrate, especially Epsom salt (MgSO4Â·7H2O), used in baths. Magnesium sulfate is mainly used in agriculture to add magnesium to soil, aiding plant growth. It's also found naturally in some minerals and springs. The compound's versatility makes it valuable in various industries.
